meanings.definition: A medieval tenant farmer who paid rent in the form of work on the lord's land.
meanings.sent1: The sokeman toiled in the fields to fulfill his duties.
meanings.sent2: The sokeman worked hard on the lord's land to pay his rent.
meanings.sent3: The sokeman tried to impress the lord with his farming skills.
meanings.sent4: The sokeman's dedication to his work was as solid as the castle walls.
meanings.sent5: The image of the sokeman laboring under the sun stayed with him for days.

meanings.definition: A person who holds land in exchange for providing military service.
meanings.sent1: The sokeman defended the land with bravery and honor.
meanings.sent2: The sokeman protected the territory as part of his duty.
meanings.sent3: The sokeman's sword was always ready for battle.
meanings.sent4: The sokeman's loyalty was as strong as the fortress walls.
meanings.sent5: The sokeman's presence on the battlefield was like a shield for his people.

meanings.definition: To work as a sokeman on a feudal estate.
meanings.sent1: He decided to sokeman for the lord to earn his keep.
meanings.sent2: She sokemans on the estate to contribute to the community.
meanings.sent3: They sokemaned with enthusiasm and dedication.
meanings.sent4: Sokemanning on the estate felt like being part of a big family.
meanings.sent5: Sokemaning under the lord's guidance was a valuable experience.
